paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant W927G, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Short QT syndrome, experienced sudden cardiac arrest

individual_records.phenotype_details: Short QT syndrome, experienced sudden cardiac arrest during marathon training.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 22-year-old, previously healthy man collapsed while running in the early evening after work in 2016.

functional_data.summary: The W927G mutation is potentially associated with a shortened QT interval.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation was originally identified in Brugada syndrome patients but not found in genuine SQTS type-1.
key_quotes: DNA analysis detected a W927G mutation in the KCNH2 gene.
An active W927G mutation is potentially associated with a shortened QT interval.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was successfully extracted.
